document.title: North Dakota English Language Arts and Literacy Content Standards

EDFA4B4949C94E72A679F9563A72EC6B.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading, being read to, and responding to texts.

E06E42DDDCBD45C8B781818E63448CA4.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

DD7CC2EF250D48A3B184B4EDD754AACB.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

AEE80BC226D34B1FA17EB3590B5E8611.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

A67EEB191DAC49A69794CDD0F57AB222.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

1B8CFA04EB8349CCACF3171B6436E343.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

583EF3C855B146968D8ECF8A7D5A8389.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

BC5AA1DE7A5E4C2B84F504A4C202465C.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

80FC07AE929F41DB8533161E7E8F10D4.description: With guidance and support from adults, determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

86B3E5D86EF84D5AA4D0BDD70E82BBA3.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

212461622D7D44C89D321B0579E69D93.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

A8F0EE564553474A801B8BF517E3B3B0.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

BD6BF36E78CD49B3B29624B7526926D6.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed and/or using spelling patterns and generalizations (e.g., word families, position-based spelling, syllable patterns, ending rules, meaningful word parts).

641B8B15C5854F95916BE4FB009CD299.description: Use conventional spelling for high-frequency and other studied words.

A3BF6993F1F44AC4811ECB287D0DDE00.description: Spell untaught words phonetically, drawing on phonemic awareness and spelling conventions.

0A4FCE04BCB24CADAA550BE77BEA754C.description: Use conventional spelling for words with common spelling patterns and for frequently occurring irregular words.

8E6921128968482297E4192A6E6DAB9B.description: Within the context of authentic English writing and speaking introduce:

14E90F35C9D3481C94BF086D591A7761.description: Use frequently occurring conjunctions (and, or, but).

1CE82AB8F146438DA066902F9B004BED.description: Use regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/.

52CE2B3F6E8446E58904EE8DD1524014.description: Produce complete sentences in shared language activities.

A047635BB4B344F0963F6C1382F5AC9A.description: Within the context of authentic English writing and speaking introduce:

18176CC6C0BA40E0A5828AAC23DCA261.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

D4D6672090364D67911E5E1E2FD82283.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

5D018E1502B64554AFBFF099A4E5C681.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

8FEED518F2964F89B57B8F915B5D1091.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

A19A8C551F914036A87994491C5A0D42.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key/supporting details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

45949DFB80524DFC83BB68E90A0AF0E7.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

1DABB742A7F34B6FB782AFDCAC5F7453.description: Follow agreed upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

AD52EA7EE2724EFC970BC5AA8F6A12E1.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

43660590D61142759BF35BBB76D8A0A1.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

D1D2AA86B3E9431A8DBE4A0D4AF006E9.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and record information learned).

79E6F05DDF5944B1852836E515BA010A.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

4E6EA45EE8C140F8A0149B51687A11BA.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including collaboration with peers.

DA3D4DA71BBC4CEC8F0F8A0217E80131.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

61BCBBC8C6264A32AFD552588A72052A.description: Production, Distribution, and Range of Writing

78815A19FF674A2E8F2CFCF7DDE17F16.description: Provide a reaction to what happened.

C06E9F163F3D4BE48DB30A5FC4C06089.description: Tell about the events in the order in which they occurred.

58FBD16D75B54ABA873D80C0990997C9.description: Narrate a single event or several loosely linked events.

3CF98C9DAD894CCC81E8B255B3EE10F2.description: Write narratives using a combination of drawing, and writing.

189CC1BD512B4360BCF715FD0FBA53F1.description: Supply some information about the topic.

A8D013E0525D41369D3B965BA90A4482.description: Name what they are writing about.

96AC9A1C6A904C4FACE00B9446A57D90.description: Write informative/explanatory texts using a combination of drawing and writing.

A8271E1E5B5B4FBF9B9DC52F4E306736.description: State an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book isâ€¦).

BAC35F31C54D4DE1AE2828600AB0196B.description: Tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about.

219A49AA100B42B2A5995346AED500B7.description: Write opinion pieces using a combination of drawing and writing.

0BB1DF7355A9482CAE2DAB5A67C477E9.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

D8E6E200E5B24EA4987227CCC180FDC5.description: Read grade level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

65DA379DF71E4DDC8E0DBB34641C73C9.description: Read grade level text with purpose and understanding.

A44A862C26434064AB6D706CA6731744.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

56800311C55F41318A4AC339E7826BAF.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

43F6F551D652442D99E780E2A14EEF4D.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight. (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

22B4CB0EFCEC49298D2489FE2FBB055E.description: Associate the long and short sounds with the common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

BF2ACEA0BA3642D19B59F6E3AC4166C1.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

F88A9AF3AC514B0AB44B759A152EAAD1.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

8D0FA8B07FD349D8BDE25655EE4289E9.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, single-syllable words to make new words.

54E00522695D41089A59FB801701C4EE.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/).

47569BF0B89D4FF795D60361D142493D.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

E585DD85F3474BA2894A8BCDBBD266DB.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

47BEF572A8F64859B5C5C13CCCABF623.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

40D98EA671274290AA6B9895E07B392B.description: Recognize and name all uppercase and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

F0FBDB1E63BD4634BC83DDE8A1B7894D.description: Understand words are separated by spaces in print.

0C77E19621764F94A156FC38F2823234.description: Recognize spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

E9BE2ECD670846E18902D1D704A5F315.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

5E5D155DE1BD4D62A6FF990F3C7040E5.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

0A39D72398014C81B7205BDC29CF119E.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

72E00B16BAEF40D1BF7914951B927593.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

3F1620D903B7436C868D70FDF8356AB5.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

1D3CEE323D4D4D259C976FE038877A70.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between photographs or illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

FB4468E457674AE894629FDA3B3C6840.description: With prompting and support, name or locate the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

A1E0D4412B62485D8C4A0B8724F708B7.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

79FA38CF2F074F0E99EB784D13E6FC31.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about words with unknown meanings in a text.

FC11FA5BBF13424892CA9075EC72E04C.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

ED68D4A8B6B34F6DB24D1DB875EA6A7C.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key/supporting details of a text.

46A2A9C92F4C46FAB3B093A089C98144.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key/supporting details in a text.

AF4F1570A89B43278B67381BBEB3E828.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

79904B5B2F6743958ADADEDF61386DD0.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

57631241CE624052AF491323C0593313.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

029E6E7C998945B1BFB5A85DE5C68324.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

A2010C679DFC438BAC5312694591155F.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

DE279C3AF7AD4D14A6B01A82A094E775.description: Recognize common types of texts using their unique features throughout the selection (e.g., storybooks, poems, fairy tales, and nursery rhymes).

2A154BB476554E4A9042FA8B4C7D052A.description: Ask and answer questions about words with unknown meanings, in a story or poem.

DF4AA6BE259F4DE0BF358517165F2BFB.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

E4401311280641EC82BF28065D6EFC91.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key/supporting details.

592EC9DBC87A455BB2E0F5BF2E8CC90A.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key/supporting details in a text before, during, and after reading.
